entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China’s Dual Crises
entries.description: Last year, China’s economy had one of its worst performances in decades. Its population is also shrinking.

entries.title: British Battery Start-Up Files for Bankruptcy
entries.description: The failure of Britishvolt is a blow to Britain’s plans to promote the manufacture of electric cars, and threatens the future of its automotive industry.

entries.title: Dutch Leader Weighs Sending Ukraine a Patriot Missile System
entries.description: On a visit to the White House, the Dutch leader said he had also talked to the German chancellor on Tuesday about aiding Kyiv.

entries.title: Iranian-American Prisoner in Tehran Starts Hunger Strike
entries.description: Siamak Namazi, an Iranian-American businessman, appealed to President Biden to negotiate with the government in Tehran for his freedom.

entries.title: European Parliament Corruption Suspect Cuts Deal With Prosecutors
entries.description: A former European lawmaker described as key to an alleged cash-for-influence operation by Morocco and Qatar has signed an agreement with the Belgian authorities.

entries.title: China Returns to Davos With Clear Message: We’re Open for Business
entries.description: Emerging from coronavirus lockdown to a world changed by the war in Ukraine, China sought to convey reassurance about its economic health.

entries.title: Zelensky Adviser Says He’ll Resign Over Comments on Dnipro Strike
entries.description: In televised comments after a devastating Russian strike in Dnipro on Saturday, the adviser, Oleksii Arestovych, said that the missile had been struck by Ukraine’s air defense system before crashing into an apartment building. He later apologized.

entries.title: In Kyiv, School Is in Session, Power or Not
entries.description: In Kyiv, Ukraine’s capital, Russian strikes and power outages are part of the school day. Teachers and students press on with resolve.

entries.title: England Is Banning Some Single-Use Plastics. Activists Say It’s a Small Step.
entries.description: Starting in October, the country will prohibit plastic plates, cutlery and other items. Environmental advocates are pushing for a more comprehensive measure.

entries.title: A flurry of diplomacy surrounding Ukraine unfolds this week.
Belarus Puts Exiled Opposition Leader on Trial for Treason
entries.description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, now based in Lithuania, denounced the proceedings as a “farce,” adding that her government-appointed defense lawyer had not responded to her attempts at contact.

entries.title: Zelensky pushes allies to move faster with aid as fears grow of a new Russian offensive.
A Wagner Fighter Defects to Norway, Promising to Expose Russian War Crimes
entries.description: The rare defection by a former member of the notorious Russian paramilitary force could aid investigations into Moscow’s atrocities.

entries.title: War Takes Center Stage at Davos as Ukraine Pleads for Aid and Weapons
entries.description: The first lady of Ukraine and Kyiv’s mayor are meeting with top executives and politicians at the annual World Economic Forum.

entries.title: A Better Covid Winter
entries.description: Covid hospitalizations have not surged so far this season.

entries.title: Germany Appoints New Defense Minister as Ukraine War Pressure Mounts
entries.description: The appointment of Boris Pistorius comes as Germany faces increasing calls to send Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: China’s Population Falls, Heralding a Demographic Crisis
entries.description: Deaths outnumbered births last year for the first time in six decades. Experts see major implications for China, its economy and the world.

entries.title: China’s Economy Stumbled Last Year With Covid Lockdowns Hobbling Growth
entries.description: New government data shows that growth for the year fell far short of Beijing’s goal. With Covid curbs lifted but the pandemic’s course uncertain, hope and fear cloud the forecast.

entries.title: The Australian Open Bans Russian and Belarusian Flags
entries.description: Tennis has struggled with its response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, which Belarus has supported.

entries.title: With 50 Dead in Peru, a Referendum on Democracy
entries.description: Weeks after the ouster of a leftist president, persistent protests and a mounting death toll have exacerbated widespread disillusionment with the country’s young democracy.

entries.title: Global Push to Treat H.I.V. Leaves Children Behind
entries.description: Sub-Saharan Africa has made steady progress in delivering lifesaving medication to adults, but young patients are harder to reach and 100,000 are dying of AIDS each year

entries.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: Britain pushes for more aid to Ukraine.

entries.title: Renewed Armenia-Azerbaijan Conflict Underlines Russia’s Waning Influence
entries.description: Russia helped end a 2020 war and its troops policed the cease-fire. But with a new crisis in the Caucasus heating up, Moscow, distracted and weakened by Ukraine, has not intervened.

entries.title: Death Toll of Russian Strike in Dnipro Rises to 40, Ukraine Says
entries.description: The authorities said 34 people remained missing after three days of searching for the living and the dead at an apartment building struck by a Russian missile in Dnipro.
